column4: I would like to do some flash development on Linux, is it possible?
certainly.
great, can you forward me somewhere to get started?
well, i just wanted to simple stuff for webdesign
But, you can certainly use eclipse if you want a full-blown IDE.
yeah true that so had a good experience, did it cost money?
well, no I dont want to go full blown for now, just a little bit
Google up some flash development archives for ubuntu in google, you'll get hundreds of results.
ok
http://www.williambrownstreet.net/wordpress/?p=78 -> will guide you through most of it using a simple text editor, gedit.
yeah, I don't know the difference, the flash site is overwhelming, and installing their prodcuts on linux is  pain
thanks for the link. I would prefer to stick to text editors
check out sublime text 2 - bad ass text editor
really, good for html, css, php, and flash?  Cause I've been using emacs, and its freezing on me when switch away and back for some reason
emacs..ugh...talk about old and out-dated.
I do a lot of ruby/rails and metasploit development.  It'll conquer just about anything.
check out sublime.  It's retarded awesome.
let me put it this way, about 2 months in its alpa state the editor was far superior then most products which have been on the shelf for years.
see the download link at http://www.williambrownstreet.net/wordpress/?p=78 for the flex sdk, it's dead now it seems, there's no Linux version there anymore
It's probably outdated.  You'll have to do some old fashion research.
lets see what stuff you do with ruby/rails
